# SAFER Program Overview (2026)

## What is SAFER?

The [Safe and Affordable Funding for Equity and Resilience (SAFER) Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/) ensures all Californians have access to safe and affordable drinking water, particularly in disadvantaged communities.

## Program Background

**Established:** Senate Bill 200 (2019)
**Administrator:** State Water Resources Control Board, Division of Financial Assistance
**Annual Funding:** $130 million for 10 years (from Greenhouse Gas Reduction Fund)

## SAFER Fund Uses

### Priority 1: Emergency/Urgent Needs
- Critical water shortages or outages
- When other emergency funds unavailable
- Immediate public health threats

### Priority 2: Systems Out of Compliance
- Community water systems failing primary health standards
- Focus on small disadvantaged communities
- School water systems

### Priority 3: Consolidation Acceleration
- Systems out of compliance or at-risk
- State small water systems
- Domestic wells with contamination

### Priority 4: Interim & Planning
- Interim solutions during long-term planning
- State small water systems
- Domestic wells above MCL

## What SAFER Covers

- **Operations & Maintenance:** Day-to-day system costs
- **Consolidation:** Connecting small systems to larger providers
- **Emergency Water:** Replacement water supplies
- **Technical Assistance:** Help understanding requirements
- **Professional Administrators:** Managing small systems
- **Construction:** Infrastructure projects
- **Planning & Design:** Project development

## Eligible Applicants

- Public agencies
- Nonprofit organizations
- Public utilities
- Mutual water companies
- California Native American Tribes
- Professional administrators
- Groundwater Sustainability Agencies

## Funding Sources Combined with SAFER

- General Fund allocations
- Cleanup and Abatement Account
- Proposition 68 Drinking Water
- Proposition 1 & 68 Groundwater
- [Drinking Water State Revolving Fund (DWSRF)](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/drinking_water/services/funding/SRF.html)

## Contact

**Phone:** (916) 327-9978 (general)
**Financial Assistance:** (916) 341-5700
**Website:** [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/)

Additional program information is available through [CA Grants Portal - SAFER](https://www.grants.ca.gov/grants/the-safe-and-affordable-funding-for-equity-and-resilience-program-safer/).

## Take Action

1. **Learn about the SAFER Program** -- Visit the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/) page for an overview of funding priorities, eligible activities, and current initiatives.
2. **Check grant eligibility** -- Review the [CA Grants Portal - SAFER](https://www.grants.ca.gov/grants/the-safe-and-affordable-funding-for-equity-and-resilience-program-safer/) listing for application requirements and current funding availability.
3. **Apply through FAAST** -- Submit applications via [FAAST](https://faast.waterboards.ca.gov) (Financial Assistance Application Submittal Tool), the online portal for all State Water Board funding programs.
4. **Contact the Division of Financial Assistance** -- Call (916) 341-5700 to discuss your project concept, determine the appropriate funding mechanism, and get application guidance.
